diagrams.description: Marketing's evolution reflects changing business paradigms and technology. The production era (1860s-1920s) focused on manufacturing efficiency. The sales era (1920s-1950s) emphasized aggressive selling techniques. The marketing concept emerged in the 1950s, prioritizing customer needs. The 4Ps framework was formalized by McCarthy in 1960. Relationship marketing gained prominence in the 1980s. The internet revolution of the 1990s birthed digital marketing. Social media transformed engagement in the 2000s. Today's marketing integrates AI, personalization, and omnichannel strategies to create seamless customer experiences.
